text: examined and testified as follows:
-  -  - EXAMINATION
Good morning.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Good morning.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Please state your name.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Kenneth Bateman.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Mr. Bateman, my name is Leonard Sabato, I represent the other driver with regard to this accident, which I think we can all agree occurred on February 24th, 2017.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You've just taken an oath to tell the truth.  Have you ever taken an oath to tell the truth before?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In what kind of capacity?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: I represented H&R Block in a lawsuit a client brought about hurting himself on a fence around one of our properties.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were a witness in the litigation?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Yes, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Other than that, have you ever had to take one?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  I'm going ask you some questions, a little bit about the accident, your background, your injuries, your treatment, things of that nature. If at any time you don't hear me, you don't understand me, please stop me and tell me and I will repeat the question, talk softer, louder, slower, whatever it takes.  Okay?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Keep in mind the court reporter is taking down everything we say.  She can't take down nods of the head, shrugs of the shoulders, hand gestures and the like, so try to keep all of your responses verbal.  Okay?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Similarly, try to wait until I finish asking the question even though you might anticipate what I'm going to ask you, again so there's only one of us talking at a time and we're not talking over each other.  Okay?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If at any time you want to take a break, use the restroom, get something to drink, just speak up and we'll accommodate you.  Okay?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I do ask, however, that if you do want to take a break, that if there is a question pending, you answer the question and then we'll take a break. If you want to talk your attorney, if you want to come back, change the answer, whatever, we'll do it that way.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What is your address?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: 2430 Oakland Drive, Norristown, Pennsylvania.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Who do you live there with?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Myself, my wife, and my youngest son.

text: Yes.

text: Two.

text: I started as an hourly employee when I was 16, and I worked myself up to a regional director in charge of 70 restaurants.  Second job, I worked with Washington Inventory Service.

speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you work there?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Okay.  And in that job, have you ever injured yourself and made a Workers' Compensation claim?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever made a Workers' Compensation claim?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.

speaker: MR. SABATO

text: I worked for a company called Delta-T Group, they specialize in staffing.  I was director of operations.

text: I believe three years, give or take.

text: H&R Block, yes, sir.

speaker: MR. SABATO

text: The beginning of May 2017.

text: Yes, sir.

text: No, sir.

text: And how about H&R Block?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  So did you continue to work from May 24th, 2017 when this accident happened until you retired in May of 2017?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: So the accident happened February 24th.

text: February 24th, right.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: So I was employed by them, but I couldn't do the job.

text: Did you work?

text: Yes.

text: Yes, sir.

text: Yes, sir.

text: No, sir.

text: Yes, sir.

text: Six months I guess is what it runs for.

speaker: MR. SABATO

text: The job requires you to visit the offices and check on them and help whatever necessary, and due to the injuries from the accident, I couldn't drive.

So what we're talking about doctors, I did want to let you know that I was taken to the hospital by ambulance at the scene of the accident.  I don't think the young lady said that.  So at the accident, I wasn't --

text: Yeah.  At the emergency room, once again, I mean, I was pretty discombobulated.  I couldn't quite remember stuff, and so I'm not quite sure what I would have told them.

text: Yes, sir.

text: I'm not sure.

text: Yes.

speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Couldn't remember.

text: No.

text: Okay.  Tell me, if you can, some of the limitations or ramifications of your injuries that you attribute to this accident?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Basically, it changed my life.  I guess from a financial standpoint, obviously I lost my job.  The job was six figures plus was the salary, so...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was your salary?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: There was a base salary and then there was a bonus.  So the base salary was, I don't know, 96, $98,000, and then bonuses up to 30 or $40,000 depending on how well you did.  So the loss of that. And then before the accident, I was very, very active, especially with my children.  I golfed with them every weekend, we bowled, we played softball, we were in a softball league.  You know, I could -- anything around the house, I could mow the grass, home repairs, all that stuff.  I could travel, I could do virtually anything I wanted.  So that was all before the accident.  And now I'm virtually almost confined to the house in a sitting position. The pain medicine, I can't do hardly anything while I'm taking the pain medicine.  My movement with my back is limited.  I have difficulty sleeping. When I go to sleep, it takes me anywhere from two to three hours before my back gets in a position where I'm comfortable enough to sleep. Even little things like, I hate to say this, excuse me, but wiping my butt after I go to the bathroom, it is painful because of the position I have to turn to to try to do it.  I can't participate in sports.  My one son lives in Boston, I can't go up and visit him because I can't travel. Any vacation plans, I did want to go to Africa and that's always been on my bucket list and stuff like that, but I can't do that.  So it's just -- it's a disaster.

text: Were you involved in anything on March 30th, 2015?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Not to my knowledge.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Now you said 50 years ago. Do you recall being in an accident in 2003?  Little bit less than 50 years.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: I don't even remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So other than this accident 50 years ago that you do remember, what did you injure in that accident?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: I don't remember.  I barely remember the accident, I remember just being in a car accident with my new car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Have ever been involved in a slip and fall or anything like that --
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- before this accident?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have ever have any sports injuries, hurt yourself bowling?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Once in a while you pull a muscle or something like that, but that's about it.  I think every athlete does that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you've never made any complaints about your low back prior to this accident?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How is your vertigo now, is that better?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Yes, excellent.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I guess you already answered this.  Since this accident, you have not been involved in anything, right?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever been in any kind of drug or alcohol rehabilitation?
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: No, sir.  Proud to say I've never had a drop of alcohol in my whole life, couldn't even tell you what it tastes like.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Wow.
speaker: MR. GITMAN

text: Never had a puff of cigarette in my whole life.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Wow.  Can we go off the record so I can use the bathroom?
speaker: MR. GITMAN

text: (Whereupon, a brief break was taken.)
That's all I have.  Thank you, sir.
speaker: MR. SABATO

text: (Whereupon, the Witness was excused.)
(Whereupon, the deposition ended at 11:27 a.m.)
